exercise.name: regular push-ups
tips: Keep in mind to go all the way down and all the way up when performing the push-ups, if a regular push up is too hard, you can make it easier by having your knees touch the floor instead of your feet when performing the pushups

If a standard push-up is too difficult, you may make it easier by touching the floor with your knees rather than your feet when executing the push-ups. Just remember to go all the way down and all the way up.

When completing push-ups, remember to go all the way down and all the way up. If a standard push-up is too difficult for you, try executing them with your knees instead of your feet touching the ground.

exercise.name: jumping jacks
tips: With hands by side, feet together, quickly jump and bring hands up while landing in a wide stance, then hands back down and feet together
Jump swiftly and bring your hands up while landing in a wide stance. Then, bring your hands back down and your feet together.
Jump swiftly and bring your hands up while landing in a wide stance. Then, with your feet together and your hands by your sides, put your hands back down.

exercise.name: tricep push-ups
tips: With a tricep focused push up, keep your elbows close to your body. The distance between your elbows and torso should be minimal, this targets more of the triceps. When in correct position, slowly lower your body to the floor and slightly touch the floor with your chest. Then push up from the floor and return to the starting position.

Keep your elbows close to your torso when doing a push-up that targets your triceps. The triceps are more effectively targeted when your elbows are close to your torso. When you are in the right position, carefully lower your body to the ground until your chest is just touching it. Once you've pushed yourself off the ground, resume your original position.

Keep your elbows close to your body when performing triceps-focused pushups. Your elbows and torso should be as close together as possible to target more of the triceps. When you are in the proper position, carefully lower your body to the ground so that your chest is just barely touching the surface. Return to your starting posture by pushing yourself up off the ground.

exercise.name: squats
tips: Remember to keep your back up straight throughout the exercise, on the way down and up. On the way down also remember to go down to a 90 degree angle, if you lack mobility stop and don't go all the way down to 90 degree angle. If you have a hard time remaining balance extending your arms in front of you could help with balance.

On the way down and up, keep your back straight during the entire workout. Remember to descend down to a 90 degree angle on the way down; if you have limited mobility, halt and do not go all the way down to the 90 degree angle. Extending your arms in front of you can aid in balance if you struggle to stay upright.

On the way up and down from the activity, maintain your back up straight at all times. On the way down, keep in mind to descend to a 90 degree angle; if you have limited mobility, halt and do not descend all the way to the 90 degree angle. Extending your arms in front of you can help you maintain balance if you struggle with it.

exercise.name: bicycle sit-ups
tips: Lie down with your knees bent, then place your hands behind your head or across each other on your chest and begin to lift your upper body to your knees. Remember to keep your knees in place and lift your torso to your knees. Then descend to the starting position and perform the next repetion in the same way.

Knees bent, start by raising your upper body to your knees while holding your hands behind your head or crossed over your chest. Lifting your torso to your knees while keeping your knees stationary is advised. After that, return to your starting position and proceed with the following repetition in the same manner.

Knees bent, start by lifting your upper body to your knees with your upper body raised off the ground. Next, position your hands behind your head or across your chest. Lifting your torso to your knees while maintaining the position of your knees. Next, return to the starting position and carry out the subsequent repetition in the same manner.

exercise.name: superman
tips: Lie face down with your arms extended out in front of you. Then raise your arms, legs and chest a few inches of the floor and pause at the top of the repetition for a second, remember to squeeze your lower back at the top of the repetion. Then begin to slowly descend back to the starting position.

With your arms out in front of you, lie face down. After that, lift your arms, legs, and chest a few inches off the ground, pause briefly at the peak of each repeat, and compress your lower back. Then, start descending gradually to the beginning point.

Your arms should be out in front of you while you lay face down. Then, elevate your arms, legs, and chest a few inches off the floor. Pause briefly at the top of each repeat, and don't forget to contract your lower back. After that, steadily decline to your starting position.

exercise.name: lungee
tips: Place one foot about 50 cm in front of you and descend your body so the front knee and foot form a 90 degree angle. Then push up from that 90 degree angle with the same front foot, returning to the original position. Now repeat the same steps with your other foot. Alternate the feet between each repetition, and remember to descend slowly, in a controlled manner.

The front knee and foot should form a 90-degree angle when you place one foot around 50 cm in front of you and lower your torso. Return to your starting posture by pushing up with the same front foot from that 90-degree angle. Now use your other foot to retrace your steps. Between each repeat, switch which foot is being used. Also, always fall steadily and slowly.

Put one foot 50 cm in front of you, then lower your body until your front knee and foot are at a 90-degree angle. With the same front foot, push up from that 90-degree angle to resume your original position. Put your second foot down and go through the same motions. Remember to fall slowly and deliberately between each repeat by switching the foot.

exercise.name: burpee
tips: Start at the bottom end of a push up position, then jump your legs up whilst also simultaneously pushing away with your upper body to come up to a upright, standing position. Now straight after standing, jump up in the same position, and raise your arms straight above your head. Then quickly return to the starting position, to be ready for the next repetition.

Begin in a push-up position at the bottom, then bounce your legs up while simultaneously pushing with your upper body to reach a standing position. After standing still, immediately spring up and extend your arms directly above your head. In order to be prepared for the following repeat, immediately return to the beginning position.

Starting in the bottom position of a push-up, jump your legs up while simultaneously pushing away with your upper body to reach a standing position. Straight away after standing, jump up into the same stance and extend your arms overhead. Once back in place, swiftly go on to the following repetition.

exercise.name: knee to elbow plank
tips: Form a plank with your body, forearms on ground, alternate bringing knee towards same-side elbow, don't go too fast and remember to control the movement.
Put your body into a plank position with your forearms on the ground. Alternately bring your knee to the elbow on the same side.
Make a plank with your torso, place your forearms on the ground, and move your knee in pairs in the same-side direction on alternate occasions.

exercise.name: tricep dips
tips: Use a bench or chair, face away from the bench or chair and put your hands on the edge of the bench or chair with your fingers facing forward, starting with straight arms. Put your legs straight out in front of you, keeping them straight in that position. Now slowly lower your upper body, once your arms reaches 90 degrees, slowly come back up again to the starting position, completing one repetition.

Use a bench or chair, turn away from it, place your hands on the edge with your fingers facing forward, and start with your arms straight. Maintaining that stance, extend your legs straight in front of yourself and lower your torso. Once your arms are at 90 degrees, steadily raise your upper body back up to the beginning position, completing one repetition.

Use a bench or chair, turn away from it, and start with your arms straight. Then, place your hands on the edge of the bench or chair with your fingers facing front. Stretch your legs straight out in front of you, keeping them that way. Next, slowly lower your upper body until your arms are at a 90-degree angle. Slowly return to the starting position to complete one repetition.

exercise.name: high knees
tips: Run in place, bringing knees up to your waist line. Remember that repetitions are listed for each leg, and not both legs.
Bring your knees up to your waist as you run in place.
Raise knees to waist, while running in place. Remember to keep your back straight while performing the exercise.

exercise.name: mountain climbers
tips: In a plank, quickly bring knees to chest, then alternate the leg your bring to chest and repeat until you have done said amount of repetitions per leg, completing one set.
Bring your knees swiftly to your chest while you are in a plank position. Then, switch whatever leg you are bringing to your chest, and repeat.
Plank position: Quickly bring knees to chest. Next, switch which leg you brought to chest. Repeat until you have completed the specified number of reps for each leg.

exercise.name: lower back raises
tips: Lie flat, face down. Put your hands behind your head, then go on and raise your upper torso, keeping your lower torso planted to the ground. If your lower body is also lifting or moving, tucking your feet under a sofa or something similar could be useful to keep it in place while performing this exercise.

Lie down face down, flat. Your lower body should remain firmly planted on the ground while you lift your upper torso after placing your hands behind your head. Tucking your feet beneath a sofa or something similar could be helpful to keep your lower body in place while executing this exercise if it is also lifting or moving.

Face down on the floor in a flat position. Place your hands behind your head before raising only your upper torso while maintaining your lower torso firmly on the ground. To keep your lower body in place while executing this exercise, tuck your feet under a sofa or something similar if your upper body is also raising or moving.

exercise.name: bicep curls
exercise.equipment: dumbbell, resistant band, other weight object
tips: Stand up straight, keep your elbows to the side of your torso. Take the weight, preferably a dumbbell and place it in your hand. If you don't have access to a dumbbell or resistance bands, a backpack or any other object that can provide resistant might suffice. Then lift the weight up with your arm, flexing your bicep and keeping your elbows still inline with your body. Remember to go all the way up, and then all the way down with the weight on this movement. Then switch arm and repeat the movement after you completed all the repetitions for the first arm, the repetitions are per arm, once repetitions are completed for both arms, the first set is completed.

Keep your elbows by your sides as you stand up straight. Place the weight in your hand, preferably a dumbbell. A rucksack or any other item that can create resistance may be sufficient if you don't have access to a dumbbell or resistance bands. Then, raise the weight with your arm while flexing your biceps and maintaining a parallel position for your elbows with your body. Keep in mind to use the weight on this action to go all the way up and then all the way down. After doing all the repetitions for the first arm—repetitions are done per arm—switch arms and continue the exercise. When both arms have had their fair share of repetitions, the first set is over.

Elbows should be kept to the sides of the torso as you stand up straight. In your hand, hold the weight—ideally a dumbbell. Any object that may produce resistance, such as a rucksack, may work in their place if you don't have access to a dumbbell or resistance bands. Once you've flexed your bicep, raise the weight with your arm while maintaining a parallel angle between your elbows and body. Just keep in mind to use your weight on this action and go all the way up and down. Once you have completed all of the repetitions for the first arm—repetitions are accomplished for each arm separately—switch arms and repeat the activity. The first set is finished once both arms have received their allotted number of repetitions.

exercise.name: leg raises
exercise.equipment: dumbbell, resistant band, other weight object
tips: Lie down straight with your back placed on the floor. Keep your legs straight and your upper body still touching the ground, lift your legs up, all the way to the top, having your feet now pointing to the ceiling at the top of the movement. Then slowly descend your legs to the starting position and repeat the movement again.

The floor should be under your back as you lie down straight. Lift your legs all the way up until your feet are now facing upward at the top of the movement. Keep your legs straight and your upper body stationary. Repeat the motion by carefully lowering your legs to the beginning position.

Your back should be on the ground when you lie down straight. Lift your legs up all the way to the top, with your feet now pointing to the ceiling at the top of the exercise. Keep your legs straight and your upper body remaining on the ground. Then slowly return your legs to the beginning position and perform the exercise once more.
